metadata.Title: CVE-2020-12408 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - low.
metadata.Description:
When browsing a document hosted on an IP address, an attacker could insert certain characters to flip domain and path information in the address bar. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 77.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-12408` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 77.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 77.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 77.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '77.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs68 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
